Taskade is a solid Notion alternative for tasks and even project management, thanks to its advanced workflow automation and collaboration features. It is also worth mentioning that it has fantastic AI features.

You can read the full review here: [Taskade Review: Features, Pricing, Pros & Cons (2025)](https://thebusinessdive.com/taskade-review)

[Try Taskade](https://taskade.com/?via=v2jxf)

### ClickUp

**Best Notion alternative for project management**

![ClickUp is one the best Notion alternatives for project management](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/ClickUp-is-one-the-best-Notion-alternatives-for-project-management-1.webp?resize=1020%2C471&ssl=1)

[ClickUp](https://try.web.clickup.com/thebusinessdive) is one of the best Notion alternatives for project management. It is an incredibly versatile app and can work as a central hub for project coordination and collaboration.

#### **Key features**

![ClickUp is a great Notion alternative](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/ClickUp-is-a-great-Notion-alternative-1.webp?resize=1020%2C462&ssl=1)

**Note-taking tools:** ClickUp has pretty solid note-taking features, considering it is a project management software. Using the slash command menu, you can add many types of blocks, such as text, headings, lists, embeds, tables, and more. Ultimately, its note-taking system and functions are similar to Notion.

**Project management tools:** It has all the project management tools you need to organize complex projects. Your dashboard works as your headquarters. You can customize what you want to see here by adding cards. For example, you can access your task lists, workloads, total and completed tasks, and more here. I enjoyed the extensive customization options here. You can drag-and-drop these cards so you can personalize your dashboard one hundred percent.

**Task management tools:** ClickUp has many task management tools. You can smoothly assign, track, add deadlines, prepare to-do lists, and so on. Your dashboard is also valuable for organizing all your tasks. With your dashboard, you can get a quick breakdown of other aspects regarding your tasks, like open tasks by the assignee or total tasks by the assignee.

**Templates:** This project management tool offers numerous templates to create projects, wikis, meeting notes, and many more.

**Automation tools:** Using ClickUp, you can choose from 100+ automations to streamline workflows and complex processes. It has many templates for automation as well, so you do not have to spend time setting up rules one by one.

**Collaboration features:** ClickUp is full of collaboration features. It shows if a teammate is simultaneously viewing a task or adding a new comment. Whenever someone makes a change in the document, it updates instantly in real-time. Also, it provides a virtual whiteboard where you can collaborate with your teammates.

**AI tools:** ClickUp’s Brain connects all the tasks, projects, documents, team members, and your company’s knowledge with AI. It makes ClickUp’s AI feature very powerful, as it has all the data to answer your questions. It offers a great way to increase your productivity and save time.

**Integrations:** ClickUp offers seamless integration with Zapier and many third-party apps, including Slack, Google Docs, Google Calendar, and some Microsoft apps. Ultimately, you will find every popular app among ClickUp’s integrations.

**Mobile app:** ClickUp has a mobile version for Android and iOS. It has many project management tools, but sometimes I feel it is slow.

#### **Pricing structure**

![Clickup pricing](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Clickup-pricing-1.webp?resize=1020%2C469&ssl=1)

ClickUp offers four pricing plans. The free plan covers 100MB of storage, unlimited tasks, unlimited members, collaborative editing, and many views. Considering other tools, ClickUp has an extensive free plan and is ideal for individuals.

The Unlimited plan is $7 and excellent for small teams who need unlimited storage, time tracking tools, integrations, and AI tools.

If you want more features and higher security, you need to go with the Business plan. It is a good choice for medium-sized businesses, as it comes with tools for timesheets and workload management.

Finally, ClickUp offers an Enterprise plan as well for larger teams at custom pricing. They also provide a demo here so you can check whether ClickUp is the right project management tool for you.

#### **ClickUp’s user interface**

![ClickUp user interface (a great Notion alternative) ](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/ClickUp-user-interface-a-great-Notion-alternative-1.webp?resize=1020%2C467&ssl=1)

ClickUp has a user-friendly interface. I loved its design and the dynamic of this whole productivity suite. Compared to Notion, it is a more beautiful project management app.

#### **My experience with ClickUp**

While ClickUp is a visually appealing app, it still has a steep learning curve, given its wide range of features. It will take some time to find and learn the tools you need for daily work.

I know that many people are seeking productivity tools that combine AI features to enhance collaboration. And for this, ClickUp is one of the best Notion alternatives thanks to its extensive set of AI tools.

Nevertheless, ClickUp is worth the time you need to spend learning its functions, as it is the best Notion alternative for managing projects.

#### **ClickUp’s pros and cons**

![Pros and cons I found after my ClickUp review](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

#### **Why is it the best Notion alternative for project management?**

ClickUp is a great Notion alternative for project management at a reasonable price. It is ideal for any size of business and offers the full tool stack to effectively organize tasks, projects, and data in a centralized place.

You can read the full review here: [My Honest ClickUp Review After Using It For +3 Months (2025)](https://thebusinessdive.com/clickup-review)

[Try ClickUp](https://try.web.clickup.com/thebusinessdive)

### Appflowy

**A budget-friendly Notion alternative for small teams**

![Appflowy is a great Notion alternative for small teams](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Appflowy-is-a-great-Notion-alternative-for-small-teams.webp?resize=1020%2C480&ssl=1)

[Appflowy](https://appflowy.io/) is an open-sourced AI-driven workspace to bring projects, wikis, and teams together. It has a similar layout to Notion, and it is an easy-to-use app.

Thanks to its collaboration, document, and project management features, it is an ideal Notion alternative that you can access with offline mode as well.

#### **Key features**

![Appflowy is a top Notion alternative](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Appflowy-is-a-top-Notion-alternative.webp?resize=1020%2C469&ssl=1)

**Note-taking tools:** Appflowy uses building blocks when creating content. It enables you to use the slash command menu so you can insert headings, text, images, boards, grids, and calendars more quickly. Appflowy is a very capable tool for writing notes or tracking your tasks and projects.

**Project management tools:** Appflowy works like a lightweight project management app, and you can organize projects easily. I loved how simple it is to use numerous view options for project management. Also, it is very simple to share your projects with your team members.

**Task management tools:** With Appflowy, you can add status, assignees, progress, dates, and many others to each project. It has all the tools you need to effectively manage tasks with your team members.

**Templates:** Appflowy has a template gallery where you can find the template that fits you and change the properties.

**Automation tools:** It has no automation features.

**Collaboration features:** Appflowy has some easy-to-use collaboration features. For instance, you can share projects with your team members and assign tasks to them.

**AI tools:** Appflowy has an AI writer feature as well. If you press slash, you can use AI to come up with new ideas, summarize text, or answer questions.

**Integrations:** It supports Zapier integrations, so you can connect Appflowy with more than 7000 third-party apps.

**Mobile app:** Appflowy has a mobile version as well. You can use this productivity tool on Android and iOS devices.

#### **Pricing structure**

![Appflowy pricing](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Appflowy-pricing-1.webp?resize=1020%2C472&ssl=1)

Appflowy has two pricing plans. The free plan includes one collaborative workspace for up to two members, unlimited pages & blocks, 5 GB storage, 10 AI responses, Intelligent search, real-time collaboration, and a mobile app.

The Pro plan includes all these features, and you can use it for up to 10 workspace members for $10 per member per month.

You can also get the AI features for $8 if you want to access the most advanced AI models, including GPT 4-o and Claude 3 Sonnet. Moreover, it is $8 to have Mistral 7B, Llama 8B, and more local models.

#### **Appflowy’s user interface**

![Appflowy user interface ](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Appflowy-user-interface-1.webp?resize=1020%2C467&ssl=1)

Appflowy has a simple and user-friendly interface. The structure of the user interface is similar to that of Notion; however, it offers a more visually appealing experience.

#### **My experience with Appflowy**

I had a positive experience with Appflowy. It was easy to navigate its pages and find the key features.

Appflowy offers a straightforward solution for organizing tasks and projects. It is particularly useful for small teams thanks to its pricing structure.

#### **Appflowy’s pros and cons**

![Pros and cons of Appflowy](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Pros-and-cons-of-Appflowy-1.webp?resize=1020%2C765&ssl=1)

#### **Why is it a budget-friendly Notion alternative for small teams**?

Appflowy is a budget-friendly Notion alternative for small teams. It has super-easy tools for managing projects and organizing data.

[Try Appflowy](https://appflowy.io/)

### Anytype

**Best Notion alternative for safe note-taking**

![Anytype review](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Anytype-review.webp?resize=1020%2C470&ssl=1)

If [Anytype](https://anytype.io/) is new to you, imagine it as a combo of Notion and [Obsidian](https://thebusinessdive.com/obsidian-review). It is a powerful all-in-one workspace that combines notes and databases in one platform. Compared to [Notion](https://thebusinessdive.com/notion-review), it has more robust note-taking capabilities, and you can access it without an internet connection using its offline mode from your devices, including your mobile.

Anytype offers maximum data ownership & privacy. It has a local first approach supporting on-device end-to-end encryption, and you are the only one with the key to the notes.

It is also worth mentioning that this is quite a complex note-taking app with a long learning curve.

#### **Key features**

![Anytype's mindmap](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Anytypes-mindmap.webp?resize=1020%2C447&ssl=1)

**Note-taking tools:** Anytype uses object-based note-taking. In the world of Anytype, everything you see and interact with is an object. Whether you add a page, image, text, file, or task, they are all objects in this note-taking app. Similarly to Notion, you can quickly add an object if you press the “slash” button. Anytype uses types to categorize these objects, and you can connect them with links and relations. Using its graph view, you can quickly overview the relations between your objects.

**Project management tools:** Anytype is an open-source, local application that allows for real-time collaboration. Although it has no project management tools, you can create your own project trackers inside the app.

**Task management tools:** It has the basic functionality to manage your to-do list. Anytype allows you to create task lists, and you can use different filter options. Although Anytype has task management features, it is a complex tool for those who just want to have a task management app.

**Templates:** Anytype has some templates prepared by the community. They help you to create and scale your object creation workflows.

**Automation tools:** Anytype has no automation tools.

**Collaboration features:** You can share your spaces with your team members, where you can collaborate with each other. Compared to other Notion alternatives, Anytype has very limited features when it comes to team collaboration.

**AI tools:** Anytype has no team collaboration features.

**Integrations:** It does not offer integrations right now.

**Mobile app:** Anytype is available on mobile devices, including iOS and Android. It worked smoothly on my mobile.

#### **Pricing structure**

![Anytype pricing](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

Anytype offers four plans.

**The free plan includes 1 GB of network space, three shared spaces, and three space members per shared space**. Using the free plan, you can sync your devices, get backup storage, and even collaborate in small groups. During my Anytype review, I also used the free plan, and I think it is ideal for your personal notes.

The builder plan provides a unique name for you: **128 GB of network space, three shared spaces, 10 Editors per shared space, unlimited viewers per shared space, and priority support**. This plan works great for small teams.

The co-creator plan is quite similar to the builder plan. However, this plan offers **256 GB of network space** and a shorter unique name. This plan is ideal for teams.

Lastly, Anytype **offers business plans upon request**, where you have the option to determine the size of the network space, number of editors, or shared spaces, and gives unlimited Viewers per shared space. This plan could be fit for bigger teams.

#### **Anytype’s user interface**

![Anytype review - objects](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Anytype-review-objects.webp?resize=1020%2C462&ssl=1)

While the way Anytype works might seem complex, it has a **simple and intuitive user interface**. On the left side, you can access everything you need, from spaces, widgets, libraries, and bins. Anytype’s user interface is optimized for mobile users as well.

#### **My experience with Anytype**

I am not going to lie; Anytype is a complex app. It took time to learn and use properly, and I needed to watch some YouTube videos as well, and read many guides. Anytype features an object-based approach to note-taking, and while it offers real-time collaboration, it is currently better for personal use.

However, it is one of the best Notion alternatives since it offers a safe place where you can take notes. Anytype implements a decentralized model that emphasizes privacy and security, which makes it one of the most privacy-focused note-taking apps.

Lastly, it has more advanced features for managing and organizing your notes than Notion and most of the note-taking apps.

#### **Anytype’s pros and cons**

![Anytype pros and cons ](https://i0.wp.com/thebusinessdive.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Anytype-pros-and-cons-1.webp?resize=1020%2C765&ssl=1)

#### **Why is it the best Notion alternative for safe note-taking?**

[Notion vs Anytype: 5 CRUCIAL Differences I Found Over 2+ Years](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YTbDEbOOj3g&list=PLrRm3Kq-V4MfL_nmxAgr29g8QYrsHkTjo&ab_channel=Thebusinessdive "Play video \"Notion vs Anytype: 5 CRUCIAL Differences I Found Over 2+ Years\"")

Here, I compare Anytype with Notion based on features, pricing, pros & cons.

Anytype is currently the safest note-taking app on the market, and it has an extensive free plan that is sufficient for individuals. With this note-taking app, you can store all your data in a safe place, and it provides almost infinite options for data organization.

Considering all these aspects, Anytype is the best free Notion alternative for individuals who need a safe note-taking app.

You can read the full review here: [Anytype Review: The Best Note-Taking App In 2025?](https://thebusinessdive.com/anytype-review)

## Frequently asked questions

### What are the best Notion alternatives?

If you are not sure if one of the Notion alternatives in the list can help your daily work, check out these options:

- [Capacities](https://capacities.io/): One of my favorite Notion alternatives that just barely missed this list. It provides journal pages for quick capturing of daily tasks.
- [Airtable](https://www.airtable.com/): Airtable is often compared to a powerful spreadsheet, excellent for users needing robust database and visualization features.
- [Trello](https://trello.com/): Trello is best for teams who prefer a simple, straightforward Kanban board for visual task management, and don’t need advanced project management tools.
- [Monday.com](https://thebusinessdive.com/monday-review): Monday.com focuses on visual project tracking, work management, and automation, making progress easy to see.
- [Asana](https://thebusinessdive.com/asana-review): Personally, it’s not my favorite, but Asana is a popular choice for managing large-scale projects with features for multiple project views.
- [Confluence](https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence): Confluence is designed to be a collaborative workspace for teams, ideal for wikis and technical documentation within the Atlassian ecosystem.
- [Evernote](https://thebusinessdive.com/evernote-review): Evernote offers powerful search functionality, easy organization via notebooks and tags, and reliable cross-platform syncing. Although it is extremely expensive, it is an okay Notion alternative for note-taking.
- [Slite](https://slite.com/): Slite is strong for teams needing to build an internal wiki, focusing on knowledge management and collaboration.

### Is there anything better than Notion?

Notion has undoubtedly become one of the most popular productivity tools. However, there are some solid Notion alternatives that have similar features with even more advanced features. For me, the best overall Notion alternative is Coda.

Related article:

- [7 Best Note-Taking Apps For 2025 \| +2 Years Personal Testing](https://thebusinessdive.com/best-note-taking-apps)

### What is better, Notion or Xtiles?

Both Notion and Xtiles are great productivity tools. Xtiles is ideal for people who need a **simple note-taking tool that offers a visual representation**. It is a powerful tool for creating visually engaging content, whether it is about project management or complex workflows. Although it does not have as many collaboration features as Notion, Xtiles is a cost-effective solution for teams.

If you are looking for a **more versatile app that you can use for note-taking, project, task, and database management**, Notion is a better alternative. It has a minimalist design with robust collaboration features.

Relating article: [Xtiles Vs Notion: All Features Compared (2025)](https://thebusinessdive.com/xtiles-vs-notion)

### Is Obsidian better than Notion?

Overall, Obsidian is a more powerful app than Notion for personal note-taking. While it is a complex app with a long learning curve, it offers many possibilities to organize your notes and brainstorm ideas. And most importantly, you can do it safely.

Nonetheless, if you are looking for an app for note-taking, project, task management, or team collaboration, Notion is a way better tool than Obsidian. Obsidian is simply not ideal for team collaboration or managing projects within a team.

Relating article: [Notion Vs Obsidian: Side-by-Side Comparison (2025)](https://thebusinessdive.com/notion-vs-obsidian)

### Does Notion or Coda have better project management tools?

If we consider the project management features, Coda is a more powerful productivity tool. It offers more views, customization, and automation features than Notion.

Relating article: [Notion Vs Coda: Side-by-Side Comparison (2025)](https://thebusinessdive.com/notion-vs-coda)
